intro: Streptanthus tortuosus subsp. truei, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and has a compact, mat-like growth form. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in open, sunny areas within mountain ranges.
